meanings.definition: A government or rule by holy or sacred persons.
meanings.sent1: The hagiarchy of the ancient temple ensured peace and harmony.
meanings.sent2: The hagiarchy in the monastery guided the decisions of the community.
meanings.sent3: The hagiarchy of wise elders made sure everyone followed the rules.
meanings.sent4: In the hagiarchy of the forest, the oldest trees held the most power.
meanings.sent5: The hagiarchy of the stars shone brightly in the night sky.

meanings.definition: A society or community governed by religious leaders.
meanings.sent1: The hagiarchy of the village was respected by all its inhabitants.
meanings.sent2: Living in a hagiarchy meant following the teachings of the religious leaders.
meanings.sent3: The hagiarchy of the town organized a festival to celebrate unity.
meanings.sent4: Under the hagiarchy of the church, traditions were upheld with reverence.
meanings.sent5: The hagiarchy of the school promoted kindness and understanding.

meanings.definition: The rule or dominion of saints or holy persons.
meanings.sent1: Legends spoke of a powerful hagiarchy that protected the land.
meanings.sent2: The hagiarchy of the ancient kingdom was believed to bring blessings.
meanings.sent3: In the hagiarchy of the legends, miracles were said to happen daily.
meanings.sent4: The hagiarchy of the mountain was said to grant wishes to those who climbed it.
meanings.sent5: The hagiarchy of the valley was a source of inspiration for all who visited.
